page.title: 05DUFTON HAY RAKES
page.content: Rakes have been made in Dufton for 90 years.Like most village joiners, this one also serves as the local under- taker.There are two styles of rake, each do the same job, but customers have preferences. It takes 2 weeks to mske 50-60 dozen rakes,but some weeks are spent just sawing wood.The shanks are imported from Malaysia as squared lengths & the rest of the wood is taken through all its stages from tree to finished product on these premises. English ash is used & local birch for the dowels.Each van load is taken to Wigan _about every 2 or 3 weeks _ a good chance,incidentally,toget to the bigger shops.This is a family business with one extra man employed.The electric machines all need constant attention from 1 or 2 individuals & keep the joiner,his wife,his father & one other busy full time.
